{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question is asking about the age at which the temporomandibular joint (TMJ) develops. Document [11] states that the jaw, which includes the TMJ, begins to develop from the fourth week. However, this does not specify the exact time when the TMJ is fully developed. Document [30] provides more specific information, stating that the TMJ anatomy and measurements appear to be related and agree with the neuro-muscular maturation time at which sucking and swallowing reflexes begin before birth, which is fully attained at about 20 weeks of development.
